item.title: Allison add a quote by Krishnamurti
item.description: "do it or don't do it but get on with it..." -- Krishnamurti

item.title: Allison add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Any idiot can face a crisis; it's this day-to-day living that wears you out." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Allison add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Gamble everything for love, if you're a true human being." -- Rumi

item.title: Allison add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul And sings the tune without the words And never stops at all." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Allison add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Allison add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "There is a vitality, a life force, an energy, a quickening that is translated through you into action, and because there is only one of you in all time, this expression is unique. And if you block it, it will never exist through any other medium and will be lost." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Allison add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "After a few months in my parents' basement, I took an apartment near the state university, where I discovered both crystal methamphetamine and conceptual art. Either one of these things are dangerous, but in combination they have the potential to destroy entire civilizations. " -- David Sedaris

item.title: Allison add a quote by Stella Adler
item.description: "life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one" -- Stella Adler

item.title: Allison add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Allison add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allison add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Find out what your hero or heroine wants, and when he or she wakes up in the morning, just follow him or her all day.." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allison add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Your intuition knows what to write, so get out of the way." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allison add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Learning to let go should be learned before learning to get. Life should be touched, not strangled. You’ve got to relax, let it happen at times, and at others move forward with it." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allison add a quote by Marisha Pessl
item.description: "Well, life isn't a cakewalk, is it?! Eighty-nine percent of the world's most valuable art was created by men living in rat-infested flats. You think Velásquez wore Adidas? You think he enjoyed the luxuries of central heating and twenty-four-hour pizza delivery?!" -- Marisha Pessl

item.title: Allison add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "Why do cats sleep so much? Perhaps they've been trusted with some major cosmic task, an essential law of physics - such as: if there are less than 5 million cats sleeping at any one time the world will stop spinning. So that when you look at them and think, "what a lazy, good-for-nothing animal," they are, in fact, working very, very hard." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "The beginning is the word and the end is silence. And in between are all the stories." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "Oh, God. What was happening to her, she was turning into a normal person." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "I can't help but think that it's an unfortunate custom to name children after people who come to sticky ends. Even if they are fictional characters, it doesn't bode well for the poor things. There are too many Judes and Tesses and Clarissas and Cordelias around. If we must name our children after literary figures then we should search out happy ones, although it's true they are much harder to find." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "The role of the artist is to ask questions, not answer them." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: Allison add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Man is what he believes." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Allison add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "The person who wants nothing, hopes for nothing, and fears nothing can never be an artist." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Allison add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Even in Siberia there is happiness." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Allison add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Love, respect, friendship, do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Allison add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "She should have done science, not spent all her time with her head in novels. Novels gave you a completely false idea about life, they told lies and they implied there were endings when in reality there were no endings, everything just went on and on and on." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "Perhaps we are on an insula ex machina, an artificial place not in the real world at all -- a backdrop for the stories we must tell." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Allison add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "I can't think of anything that excites a greater sense of childlike wonder than to be in a country where you are ignorant of almost everything." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Allison add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "O may I join the choir invisible Of those immortal dead who live again In minds made better by their presence; live In pulses stirred to generosity, In deeds of daring rectitude..." -- George Eliot

item.title: Allison add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Animals are such agreeable friends―they ask no questions, they pass no criticisms." -- George Eliot
